contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|KG|Kg|kG|kg|.kg}} '''KG''', '''Kg''', '''kG''' or '''kg''' may refer to: ;law/legal * ''[[Kammergericht]]'', the ''Oberlandesgericht'' (Provincial Appeal Court) in Berlin, Germany * [[Kommanditgesellschaft]], a German version of a limited partnership ;territories/locations *[[King George County, Virginia]] *[[Kongo language]] (ISO 639 alpha-2) *[[Kragujevac]], in Serbia *[[Kwansei Gakuin University]], in Japan *[[Kyrgyzstan]] (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code) *[[Kampung]], Malay word for village, found in placenames ;military *''[[Kampfgeschwader]]'', a unit of command in the former German ''Luftwaffe'' *''[[Kampfgruppe]]'', "KG", a flexible combat formation used by Axis forces during World War II *Kriegsgefangener, German term for [[prisoner of war]]. During WWII, the clothes of POWs in Germany were painted with the initials ''KG''. ;people/persons *[[Knight of the Garter]], "KG", a member of an English order of chivalry *''[[König]]'', the German language word for King *[[King]], Kg. when following the name of a Christian saint *[[Ken "KG" Cunningham]], Australian radio presenter and cricketer *[[Kyle Gass|Kyle "KG" Gass]], American musician and one-half of [[Tenacious D]] *[[Kevin Garnett]], American basketball player currently with the NBA's Boston Celtics *[[Kindergarten]], the grade preceded by pre-school and followed by first grade *[[KG (wrestler)]], Japanese professional wrestler ;science *[[kilogauss]], "kG", unit of magnetic field *[[kilogram]], "kg", the SI base unit of mass *[[Klein-Gordon equation]], particles in quantum mechanics ;title *[[Kasparov's Gambit]], an Electronic Arts chess videogame. ;transport *[[Volkswagen Karmann Ghia]], designed by the Italian firm Ghia, and built by German coach builder Karmann *[[Ship's center of gravity above keel]] *[[LAI - Línea Aérea IAACA]], via its IATA airline designator {{disambiguation}}
